arts.ttl: Stoke player ratings vs Preston as late drama livens up result written in stars
arts.sum: Wouter Burger did slide a shot into the post at close range from a Stoke corner mid-way through the first half and Milutin Osmajic somehow conspired to scuff up a free hit at the back post when he was unmarked and seemed certain just to tap home. It was Burger who was lurking at the back post again when Woodman couldn’t get a glove on a Manhoef deliver but this time the midfielder lacked the conviction to smash it home.

arts.ttl: Woodman earns bizarre late red as Preston hold Stoke
arts.sum: Stoke extended their unbeaten run to five in the Sky Bet Championship with a 0-0 draw against Preston.

arts.ttl: Preston hold on to draw at Stoke despite late Freddie Woodman red card
arts.sum: North End keeper Woodman was sent off for deliberately handling the ball outside the box late on.

arts.ttl: Stoke City v Preston North End live updates and team news from the bet365 Stadium
arts.sum: The league rules and regulations that Stoke (and Preston) had helped write meant that clubs were obliged to play full strength sides in that competition but two Stoke first teamers – Jimmy Sayer and Alf Edge – ‘accidentally’ missed the train north so could join the reserves in the cup. Preston have in the last couple of years overtaken Stoke, for instance, in the all-time list of Football League 0-0 draws and have this season become the first club to break the 400 barrier.
